transcript.text: manufacturing consent the political
economy of the mass media by Edward S
Hermann and Noam Chomsky it critically
examines the role of the mass media in
shaping public opinion the authors argue
that the media which are largely
controlled by corporate and political
Elites act as a powerful propaganda tool
that helps to manufacture consent among
the general public drawing on extensive
empirical evidence Hermann and Chomsky
show how the media operate within a
system of ideological control that
supports the interests of those in power
and marginalizes dissenting voices the
book presents a compelling critique of
the mainstream media's bias and
propaganda showing how it shapes public
opinion and promotes the interests of
the powerful it highlights the
importance of a free and independent
media that is accountable to the public
rather than to corporate and political
interests with its incisive analysis and
Powerful insights manufacturing consent
remains a must read for anyone
interested in the politics of media and
the ways in which the mass media shape
our world
